This next item, Lonnie, is also an important turning point in history.
What we have in front of us is one of the many pens that Lyndon Johnson used to sign the Voting Rights Act in 1965.
The Voting Rights Act is finally the culmination of the Civil War and the 14th and 15th Amendment.

The fact that it took another 100 years before you could guarantee that the federal government would do everything they can to ensure African-Americans could vote on the equal basis with non-African-Americans is pretty powerful.
Until then, in some counties, there were literacy tests or property requirements, and this effectively said you can't do that.
